meanings.definition: To draw away the attention of
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside can distract students during a test.
meanings.sent2: Please do not distract the driver while they are focusing on the road.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to distract the cat with a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her colorful outfit can distract you from noticing her new haircut.
meanings.sent5: The bright fireworks in the sky distract everyone at the party.

meanings.definition: To disturb or trouble the mind of
meanings.sent1: The scary movie can distract young children before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: His constant complaints about the weather distract her from enjoying the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The idea of spiders in the room can distract him from focusing on his homework.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved issue at work can distract her thoughts during dinner.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunderstorm outside can distract the dog from sleeping peacefully.

meanings.sent1: The detour sign will distract drivers away from the closed road.
meanings.sent2: She tried to distract his attention from the surprise party by mentioning a movie.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a shiny object to distract the audience from his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain shower can distract hikers from continuing on the trail.
meanings.sent5: The interesting book can distract her from finishing her chores.
